result.execSummary:
The defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004960325101, arrest date 3-10-14, MCSO.

Defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Intern Ian Vance-Curzan under the supervision of Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 105 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence being served, with credit for 0 DAYS time served and Huber privileges for employment and school - this is STAYED to 7-03-14, 10:00 a.m.  NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory applicable costs, surcharges, and assessments by 3-30-15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample if not previously done so - pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Appeal rights given by the court.
Filed,
Sentencing Referral Form (copy);
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Benjamin Lindsay for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Jessica Ballinger.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Shundale Lamar Joshua Jr
Current: 2171 N Sherman Blvd, Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 03-10-2014)
Prior: 2171 N Sherman Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Shundale Lamar Joshua in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Rose Larson with Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility call the court and informed the court that this Defendant, on this case, has been custody since 01-22-2014. He has a release date of 04-22-2014.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
